intro: Zonanthemis corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered aster, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with yellow centers and white to pink petals, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. Zonanthemis corymbosa is often found in moist, woodland habitats and can grow up to 1 meter in height. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem.
